If you make ThemeManager itself an object you won't need to do the companion object thingy.
https://kotlinlang.org/docs/tutorials/kotlin-for-py/objects-and-companion-objects.html

Can we rename the themes (or the enums) to have consistent naming?
It doesn't make sense to me like this:

Dark, Theme_Jellyfin
Emerald, Theme_Jellyfin_Legacy
Hotdog, Theme_Jellyfin_HotDogStand
Isn't it possible to use activity.setTheme() here?
The activity has to be recreated for the theme to be applied.
You forgot to update these with the enum change. (They should be exactly the same as the enums)
Adding app:useSimpleSummaryProvider="true" will show the currently selected theme as "description".
